sentence.Network_en: A wall collapsed and 39 people, were killed in the panic-stricken stampede.
sentence.Network_cn: 一堵墙倒了，慌乱中有39人死于踩踏事故。

sentence.Network_en: Foreign aid workers will not be allowed into the stricken areas.
sentence.Network_cn: 国外救援人员不准进入灾区。

sentence.Network_en: He was panic-stricken at the thought he might never play again.
sentence.Network_cn: 一想到自己可能永远不能再参加比赛，他就无比恐慌。

jx.jx_en_mean: (dated)used euphemistically to describe someone old and feeble

entry.def: Stricken is the past participle of some meanings of strike .

entry.tran: 受煎熬的;患病的;遭受挫折的;受灾的
entry.def: If a person or place is stricken by something such as an unpleasant feeling, an illness, or a natural disaster, they are severely affected by it.

example.ex: ...a family stricken by genetically inherited cancer...
example.tran: 受遗传性癌症折磨的一家

example.ex: Foreign aid workers will not be allowed into the stricken areas.
example.tran: 国外救援人员不准进入灾区。

means.word_mean: 2. (used in combination) affected by something overwhelming;
